body_html:
@yinghai Thanks for the question. The "MKLDNN" library Caffe2 currently uses is not the right MKL-DNN library but is actually the "MKL-ML" binary library which Intel discontinued to support. We are now upstreaming the integration of the right open-source MKL-DNN library which supports latest HW and also Intel has long-term commitment to it.

On the other hand, iDeep is a wrapper around MKL-DNN library to make its integration easier. You may notice the simplicity from the lines of integration code. iDeep also targets backend subgraph level optimization which MKL-DNN does not provide.

body:
@yinghai Thanks for the question. The "MKLDNN" library Caffe2 currently uses is not the right MKL-DNN library but is actually the "MKL-ML" binary library which Intel discontinued to support. We are now upstreaming the integration of the right open-source MKL-DNN library which supports latest HW and also Intel has long-term commitment to it.

On the other hand, iDeep is a wrapper around MKL-DNN library to make its integration easier. You may notice the simplicity from the lines of integration code. iDeep also targets backend subgraph level optimization which MKL-DNN does not provide.
